tweets.text: @Sarah_Winckless @theboatrace @matthewcpinsent @JenBartram @BBCSport @jamescracknell @CUBCsquad @stuartatcorpus @clarebalding @NatureUK @EnvAgency @metpoliceuk @MetPolice @OxfordUniBC @CambsCops @DanielZeichner @ClarenceHouse @EnvAgencyAnglia @Cambridge_Uni @PryorFrancis @cam_uni 18-11-2019 I picked up cement bag of plastic drinking bottles and rubbish from the CUBC site of Special Scientific Interest which they persuaded Wittlesea police officers to incinerate. Evidence destroyed.  That's the clout of Cambridge University. https://t.co/jmi1BlZJYl

Not only has the @EnvAgency reduced itself to becoming nothing more than a hot bed of mediocrity and incompetence it appears it now also become an apologist and spin doctor for the water industry.

Over 3,100,000 hours worth of sewage dumped into our rivers in 2020. Shame on you. https://t.co/itIVQGDyk1

PLEASE!! Do you really think we will fall for this. The overflows are spewing their filth into our rivers all year round not just in storms. Quick q&a @EnvAgency - how many Met Office storms last year versus number of storm overflows releases. Any notion of correlation? https://t.co/LU1fSJar19

@flea79 @LandStinks @adamsharered i hope the CEO can sleep at night knowing my 4 year olds and 3yr old, and many other children are being woken up at silly o clock upset and unable to explain y, just it stinks, and they cant have outdoor playtime at school because it stinking.. well done 4 ruining school memorys

Together with Mayor @PhilipGlanville and Cllr @ChrisMylesK, we wrote a letter to @EnvAgency demanding action to clean up River Lea.

@richard_hopper @EnvAgency

@EnvAgencySE are you proposing to take some action in this case - our river is being polluted with raw sewage with a complete failure of @thameswater to take any remedial action. https://t.co/LXH9eZIPFF

@thameswater, please get a crew down there ASAP and stop this happening. There has been no rainfall, so this is simply a failure of your infrastructure due to chronic under investment. You are turning our beautiful river into an open sewer and it is not acceptable.

urls.title: What is a storm overflow and how do they work?
urls.description: Heard of a storm overflow but not sure what it is? Watch this to find out what they are, why they operate and what we do to minimise their impact on the wate...

tweets.text:
What are storm overflows, and why do we use them?

Storm overflows play a role in preventing sewage from entering our homes or streets during periods of heavy rain or storms.

Watch our video to find out more about storm overflows: https://t.co/VBJFNTBAVE

Who‚Äôs going to own the task of removing this fly tipped waste that‚Äôs made its way downstream? Manchester - M4, River Irk at Scotland Wier @EnvAgency @InlandWaterways @ManCityCouncil #flytipping #waste #manchester https://t.co/knuyXxoeU6
